It sounds like you're taking a well-rounded approach to your fitness and athletic pursuits! Cross-training with different sports can be an excellent way to improve your overall athleticism and prevent plateaus. Tennis, basketball, and volleyball all require quick movements, agility, and hand-eye coordination, which can complement each other nicely.

Focusing on your backhand slice is a great way to improve your tennis game. It's a tricky shot to master, but with consistent practice and dedication, you'll get there! What specific areas of your backhand slice are you working on improving? Is it the footwork, racket positioning, or follow-through?

By the way, how do you find that your tennis training is translating to your cycling? Are you noticing any improvements in your endurance or leg strength that might be helping you with your cycling event preparation?
